ca.usask.simlab.odeToJava.controller

Class IVPController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.usask.simlab.odeToJava.controller.IVPController

  • public class IVPController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts as a wrapper for much of the functionality of ODEToJava.

    Use this class by creating a new instance of it, then using the methods to set the parameters that control the solver, and then by calling the run() method to actually run the solver.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  IVPController.ErrorControl
      The supported error control methods.
      static class  IVPController.Output
      The types of interpolation/output methods.
      class  IVPController.RunnableSolver
      Wrapper for an ODEToJava solver in a class that can be run in a separate thread.

      • write_at_array

        public void write_at_array(org.jscience.mathematics.vectors.Float64Vector array)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Write at specific points in the solution interval.
        Parameters:
        array - The array of points to write at. Must be in increasing order and fall within the interval from the initial time of the IVP to its final time.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The array is invalid.

      • set_initial_stepsize

        public void set_initial_stepsize(double step)
        Set the initial stepsize. If this is a constant-stepsize solver, this is the stepsize that will be used for the entire solution process.
        Parameters:
        step - The initial stepsize.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the stepsize is non-positive.

      • set_initial_stepsize

        public void set_initial_stepsize(org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 step)
        Set the initial stepsize. If this is a constant-stepsize solver, this is the stepsize that will be used for the entire solution process.
        Parameters:
        step - The initial stepsize.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the stepsize is non-positive.
